challenge.title: Step 84
challenge.description: Declare a toNumberList function that takes an args parameter and implicitly returns the result of splitting the args by commas. Then chain a map method to your split method and pass in parseFloat as the argument to the map method.

tests.text: You should use const to declare your toNumberList variable.
Your toNumberList variable should be an arrow function.
Your toNumberList function should use an implicit return.
Your toNumberList function should return the result of calling the .split() method of args.
You should chain the .map() method to the .split() method.
You should pass a reference to parseFloat as the callback to .map().
